homepage.heroSubtitle: Shiatsu: The Art of Holistic Well-being

aboutIntro.heading: Welcome, I am Nathalie JEAN
aboutIntro.paragraph: The art of energetic diagnosis through observation, listening, questioning, and touch. For over 20 years, I have used these four fundamental pillars to offer authentic holistic support. My practice is nourished by three master schools: the Namikoshi school for anatomical rigor, the Masunaga school for the psychosomatic dimension, and the Seiki school for the accompaniment of vital energy. Each session is a journey towards your inner balance, guided by an old, non-judgmental acquaintance.

cards.title: Nervous Relaxation (Namikoshi)
cards.description: Harmonization of the nervous system through precise anatomical pressures. Scientifically validated techniques to reduce cortisol and adrenaline, promoting the release of natural endorphins.

cards.title: Emotional Balance (Masunaga)
cards.description: Psychosomatic approach integrating extended meridians and the theory of the 5 elements. Diagnosis by abdominal palpation (Hara) to identify deep emotional imbalances.

cards.title: Ki Circulation (Seiki)
cards.description: Accompaniment of vital energy through minimalist touch and synchronized breathing. Gyooki technique (breathing with the hands) to reharmonize the subtle energetic circulation.

cards.title: Certified Perinatal Support
cards.description: Specialized protocols for pregnancy (from 4 months) and postpartum. Techniques adapted for lower back pain, edema, and childbirth preparation. Ohashiatsu Advanced certification for maternity.

cards.title: Digestive Regulation (TCM)
cards.description: Stimulation of Reflexotherapy points and Spleen-Pancreas, Stomach, Intestines meridians according to Traditional Chinese Medicine. Manual techniques for functional digestive disorders.

cards.title: Immune Reinforcement
cards.description: Activation of key acupuncture points (36ST, 6SP, 20GV) to stimulate natural defenses. Proven methods to increase resistance to seasonal infections.

whatIsShiatsuSection.heading: Shiatsu Recognized by the WHO
whatIsShiatsuSection.paragraph: Since 1997, the World Health Organization (WHO) has recognized Shiatsu as a 'non-conventional method of care worthy of interest.' This authentic Japanese manual therapy uses rhythmic pressure from fingers and palms to rebalance the circulation of Ki (vital energy) in the meridians. My in-depth training in the three founding schools allows me to adapt each session to your specific needs: the rigorous anatomy of Namikoshi, the psychosomatic approach of Masunaga, and the energetic finesse of Seiki.

whoIsItForSection.heading: A Complementary Medical Approach For All

testimonials.quote: Special attention to cardiovascular disorders, high blood pressure, diabetes, and thyroid disorders. Shiatsu effectively complements conventional medical treatments.
testimonials.name: Adults

testimonials.quote: Specialized support for osteoarthritis, rheumatism, osteoporosis, and balance disorders. Special precautions for anticoagulant treatments.
testimonials.name: Seniors

testimonials.quote: Formal contraindications in the 1st trimester. From the 4th month: relief of lower back pain, edema, and preparation for childbirth. Prior medical advice is mandatory.
testimonials.name: Pregnant Women

testimonials.quote: Pre-competition and post-effort protocol. Caution with recent injuries, severe sprains, and fractures. Coordination with sports doctors and physiotherapists.
testimonials.name: Athletes

testimonials.quote: Adapted approach for eating disorders, scoliosis, growing pains. Special attention to depressive states and anxiety disorders. Parental support recommended.
testimonials.name: Teenagers

testimonials.quote: Prevention of Musculoskeletal Disorders (MSDs), management of professional stress and burnout. Certified interventions for Quality of Life at Work (QWL).
testimonials.name: Companies

testimonials.quote: Ultra-gentle techniques for colic, sleep disorders, and psychomotor development. Contraindications: fever, infections, heart conditions. Written parental consent required.
testimonials.name: Babies

staticReviews.text: To try it is to love it.

I saw Nathalie for Shiatsu sessions for almost 2 years and I warmly recommend her. Her experience is undeniable, but it's also her personality that will make you come back! A wonderful encounter and a definite sense of well-being after leaving the sessions. Thank you, Nathalie!
Expert practitioner, experienced and very attentive. Bravo!
Very dynamic, effective, attentive, and gives great advice. I recommend her.
A warm welcome and authentic listening, you feel confident from the very first minutes. A sense of well-being felt from the first appointment. Thank you so much, Nathalie!

officialRecognition.title: Official Recognitions
officialRecognition.description: Certified practitioner with official registration numbers

shiatsuPage.title: Shiatsu: A Detailed Approach to Japanese Manual Therapy
shiatsuPage.subtitle: Shiatsu (指圧), literally 'finger pressure', is a practice with ancient roots, officially recognized in Japan, which has won over the world with its effectiveness and holistic philosophy.

definition.heading: Definition and Origin
definition.p1: Shiatsu consists of applying rhythmic pressure over the entire body with the goal of rebalancing the organism and improving or maintaining health. This manual technique mainly uses the thumbs and palms of the hands, but sometimes also the elbows, knees, and even feet to exert pressure on specific points (tsubos) located along the energy meridians.

history.heading: Historical Roots
history.p1: The origins of Shiatsu date back to the introduction of Chinese medicine (Kampo) in Japan between the 7th and 9th centuries, notably the Tui Na technique. Over the centuries, Japanese practitioners developed their own approach, giving rise to the anma massage. The term 'shiatsu' itself was chosen in 1919 by Tenpeki Tamaï, but it is Tokujiro Namikoshi (1905-2000) who is considered the inventor of modern shiatsu, thanks to his foundational experience of healing his mother's rheumatism with finger pressure.

principles.heading: Fundamental Principles: The Philosophy of Ki
principles.p1: Shiatsu considers the human being in its physical, psychic, and mental entirety. It is based on the concept of the circulation of vital energy (called Qi in Chinese and Ki in Japanese) through energy channels called meridians. According to this philosophy, any imbalance results from a blockage in this energy circulation.

objectives.heading: Therapeutic Objectives
points: To release and regulate vital energy
To prevent dysfunctions related to internal imbalances
To reduce tensions settled in the body
To stimulate the body's natural defenses
To activate the parasympathetic nervous system for recovery and well-being

techniques.heading: Techniques and Practice
techniques.p1: The practitioner uses various pressure techniques. The most common is ordinary pressure: applied gently to a point then gradually released over 3 to 5 seconds. Modern shiatsu also incorporates stretching, joint mobilization, and vibrations as needed.
techniques.p2: Breathing plays a crucial role. The practitioner and receiver synchronize their breaths to facilitate relaxation and fluidity of movement, encouraging a harmonious flow of Ki.

schools.heading: The Three Founding Schools of Modern Shiatsu

items.title: Namikoshi School
items.description: The Original, Scientific, and Therapeutic Shiatsu

content.heading: Founder and History
content.text: Tokujiro Namikoshi (1905-2000) is universally recognized as the father of modern shiatsu. His revolutionary approach emerged from a personal experience: at age 7, he empirically discovered that 'pressure' was more beneficial than friction for relieving his mother's rheumatism. The health of his mother improved considerably, and she lived to be 88 years old.

content.heading: Institutional Development
content.text: In 1925, Namikoshi opened his first clinic. The turning point came in 1955 when he obtained the official license from the Japanese Ministry of Health for his school. This governmental recognition gave shiatsu medical legitimacy, reinforced by the fame of illustrious patients like Marilyn Monroe and Mohamed Ali.

content.heading: Philosophy and Technical Approach
content.text: Namikoshi shiatsu is distinguished by its rigorous anatomical and physiological approach, in line with modern Western medicine. It favors the study of the body's physical structure over traditional Chinese energy concepts.

content.heading: Seven Therapeutic Effects
content.text: Tokujiro Namikoshi lists seven therapeutic effects of shiatsu that stimulate the proper functioning of the body:
list: Harmonization of the nervous system
Activation of viscero-cutaneous reflexes
Improvement of arterial circulation
Correction of the skeleton
Deep relaxation
Stimulation of natural defenses
Homeostatic balance

content.heading: Pressure Method
content.text: Namikoshi shiatsu exclusively uses the fingers and palms of the hands. The pressures are performed according to three fundamental principles:
list: Perpendicular pressure to the receiver's body
Maintaining pressure for 3 to 5 seconds
Total concentration of the practitioner

content.heading: Rigorous Protocols
content.text: The Namikoshi school teaches standardized katas (forms) that allow for the systematic application of techniques. These protocols include key elements of chiropractic, harmoniously integrated into the manual practice.

items.title: Masunaga School
items.description: Zen Shiatsu and the Psychosomatic Dimension

content.heading: Founder and Theoretical Innovation
content.text: Shizuto Masunaga (1925-1981) revolutionized shiatsu by reintegrating the traditional Eastern roots. A graduate in psychology, he brought an unprecedented psychosomatic dimension to the practice. A former student of Namikoshi, he founded the Iokaï school in 1960 and developed his own system, which he named 'Zen Shiatsu'.

content.heading: Major Conceptual Innovations
content.text: Masunaga's most significant contribution is the development of extended meridians over the entire body. With his psychology background, he developed a unique psychosomatic approach, considering emotional imbalances as primary factors.
list: Energy meridians (keiraku)
The theory of the five elements (gogyō)
Yin-yang concepts
Acupuncture points (tsubo)
Taoist philosophy

content.heading: Zen Shiatsu Techniques and Philosophy
content.text: Masunaga distinguishes two types of touch: Shokushin (technical and professional) and Setsushin (warm and empathetic). Setsushin is the essence of Zen Shiatsu, involving a deep connection between practitioner and receiver.
list: A meditative approach during the session
The development of the practitioner's intuition
Energetic listening rather than mechanical application
The integration of spiritual aspects into the treatment

content.heading: Sophisticated Energetic Diagnosis
content.text: Masunaga developed complex pathological charts to identify specific energy imbalances. This diagnostic approach includes observing Chinese pulses, examining the tongue, and abdominal palpation (hara).

content.heading: Founder and Training
content.text: Akinobu Kishi (1949-2012) represents the ultimate synthesis of shiatsu traditions. Trained at both the Namikoshi and Iokaï (Masunaga) schools, he assisted Masunaga for ten years. This dual training gave him a unique mastery. At 29, he experienced a profound transformation of consciousness that gave rise to Seiki Soho.

content.heading: Philosophy of Seiki Soho
content.text: The term 'Seiki Soho' means 'accompaniment of vital energy.' This approach is based on major philosophical concepts:
list: Shintoism: connection with the spirits of nature.
Wei Wu Wei: Taoist principle of 'doing by not-doing,' acting effortlessly.
Mushin: a state of empty mind, free from ego, without expectation.

content.heading: Approach and Techniques
content.text: Seiki is defined as 'minimalist bodywork.' The fundamental technical principle is Gyooki, 'breathing with the hands.'
list: A delicate touch like a butterfly on a flower.
A respiratory connection between practitioner and receiver.
Energetic listening rather than active intervention.
Ki-Do-Ma: the right action, at the right time, in the right place.

philosophy.heading: Philosophy of Ki and Energy Circulation
philosophy.introduction: My practice is based on a deep understanding of oriental energetic principles, enriched by 20 years of clinical experience and the study of three master schools.

concepts.title: Ki - Universal Vital Energy
concepts.description: Ki (or Qi in Chinese) is the fundamental energy that animates all life. In the human body, it circulates along channels called meridians, nourishing every organ, every cell. My role is to detect blockages, excesses or energy voids and restore harmonious circulation.

concepts.title: Seiki - Accompanying the Energy
concepts.description: According to Master Kishi's teaching, Seiki means 'accompanying vital energy'. This subtle approach forces nothing but listens, feels, and guides energy towards its natural state of balance. It is an art of presence and developed intuition.

concepts.title: Wei Wu Wei - Acting through Non-Action
concepts.description: Fundamental Taoist principle: acting with minimum intervention for maximum efficiency. My hands become instruments of listening rather than action. It is your own energy that guides the healing process, I only accompany it.

concepts.title: Mushin - The Mind Without Mind
concepts.description: State of consciousness free from any expectation, any judgment. During the session, I enter this meditative state that allows an authentic connection with your energy. It is in this mental void that therapeutic intuition can fully express itself.

philosophy.integration: These concepts are not just theory - they are lived and integrated into every moment of the session. After 20 years of practice, they have become the very substance of my approach, allowing support of rare authenticity.

sessionFlow.heading: How a Session Unfolds
sessionFlow.p1: A session generally lasts between 1 hour and 1.5 hours. It always begins with a discussion to identify imbalances and tensions.
sessionFlow.p2: Shiatsu is practiced fully clothed in comfortable, flexible attire, traditionally on a futon on the floor. After the session, it is common to feel deep relaxation, a sense of lightness, or sometimes slight fatigue, indicating that the body has worked and released tensions.

pourQuiPage.title: Who is Shiatsu For?
pourQuiPage.subtitle: A holistic practice that adapts to all ages and physical conditions, offering specific benefits for every need.

cards.title: Companies
cards.description: Shiatsu for Quality of Life at Work (QWL)

content.heading: Context and Challenges
content.text: The modern professional world generates considerable levels of stress. 24% of French employees are in a state of hyperstress, a major risk to their health (burnout, depression, sleep disorders). Shiatsu fits perfectly into QWL and CSR initiatives.

content.heading: Specific Benefits
list: Reduction of stress and tension.
Prevention of Musculoskeletal Disorders (MSDs).
Improvement of productivity and employee well-being.
Prevention of Psychosocial Risks (PSRs).

content.heading: Practical Arrangements
list: Short sessions of 15 to 20 minutes on a chair.
Practiced fully clothed and without oil.
Requires only a quiet space of 4-5 m².

content.heading: Main Applications
content.text: For adults, shiatsu addresses the challenges of modern life by acting on multiple levels to soothe the body, restore vitality, and strengthen the immune system.

content.heading: Preventive and Curative Benefits
list: Management of stress, fatigue, and anxiety.
Relief from back, muscle, and joint pain.
Improvement of blood and lymphatic circulation.
Significant improvement in sleep quality.

content.heading: Specific Adaptations
content.text: Shiatsu for seniors requires special technical adaptations, with gentler pressures and movements tailored to each individual's condition (armchair, bed, etc.).

content.heading: Major Benefits
list: Relief from chronic pain (osteoarthritis, rheumatism).
Improvement of mobility, balance, and reduction of stiffness.
Psychological support, reduction of anxiety, and improved sleep.
Gentle accompaniment to offer comfort and presence.

content.heading: Specifics of Adolescence
content.text: Adolescence is a period of intense transformation. Shiatsu offers excellent support to calm, recenter, and secure young people.

content.heading: Benefits for Behavior and Well-being
list: Management of emotions and stress, especially during exams.
Improvement of self-confidence and a sense of security.
Help with concentration and prevention of academic burnout.
Promotes openness, communication, and improves sleep.

content.heading: Adaptations by Trimester
content.text: Shiatsu is specifically adapted to each stage of pregnancy, with targeted sessions to soothe nausea in the first trimester, relieve back pain in the second, and prepare the body for childbirth in the third.

content.heading: Maternal Benefits
list: Relief from pregnancy discomforts: lower back pain, heavy legs, nausea.
Emotional support, reduction of anxiety, and connection with the baby.
Preparation for childbirth by relaxing the pelvis.
A prior medical opinion is always recommended.

content.heading: Adapted Techniques
content.text: Shiatsu for babies uses very gentle strokes and movements in short sessions (5 to 20 minutes) for harmonious development. Parents can also learn simple techniques to calm their child.

content.heading: Benefits for Infants
list: Improvement of sleep disorders and reduction of restlessness.
Effective digestive support against colic and regurgitation.
Strengthening of the immune system.
Contribution to the body's balance and development.

content.heading: Preparation and Recovery
content.text: Shiatsu offers comprehensive support for athletes of all levels, whether for preparing for a competition or for accelerating post-effort recovery.

content.heading: Specific Benefits
list: Improved performance through better muscle oxygenation.
Injury prevention through muscle relaxation.
Accelerated recovery by promoting the elimination of toxins.
Reduction of competitive stress and improved concentration.

otherServices.heading: Corporate Services
otherServices.intro: Physical and mental well-being at work is a performance driver. I develop individual or group sessions tailored to the needs of your employees to manage stress, renew dynamism, and improve cohesion.

items.name: DO-IN (Group Self-Massage)
items.description: Using simple energy exercises (stretching, pressure, friction), Do In helps improve joint mobility, chase away stress, and regain dynamism.

items.name: ZEN STRETCHES (Makko Ho)
items.description: Ideal for reconnecting with your body, combating stress, and relaxing without strain. Each posture, held for 6 deep breaths, brings relaxation and release.

items.name: Introduction to Hand Relaxation
items.description: A massage that brings immediate relaxation to relieve stress and soften joints, while stimulating blood circulation and overall well-being.

items.name: Sophrology
items.description: This gentle and accessible practice helps strengthen self-confidence and improve stress management through visualization and breathing techniques, reducing muscle tension.

items.name: Controlled Breathing
items.description: Breathing exercises, with or without visualization, provide reusable daily tools to manage emotions, improve concentration, and relieve pain.

items.name: Meditation and Relaxation
items.description: Accessible to everyone, these disciplines help release tension, establish a state of calm, and can fit into the busiest schedules for immediate benefit.

items.name: Participatory Conference
items.description: Explore tools for a holistic health approach, from the 5 elements theory to the circadian clock, to better understand how natural phenomena influence the body.

practicalInfoPage.title: Practical Information
practicalInfoPage.subtitle: Everything you need to know to prepare for your session and fully enjoy its benefits.

steps.name: BO SHIN (Observation)
steps.description: Visual diagnosis: posture, gait, complexion, expression. I observe your constitution according to the criteria of Traditional Chinese Medicine to adapt my approach.

steps.name: MON SHIN (Questioning)
steps.description: In-depth interview about your medical history, current treatments, contraindications. Evaluation of your emotional state and therapeutic goals.

steps.name: SETSU SHIN (Palpation & Treatment)
steps.description: Tactile diagnosis by palpation of the meridians and the Hara (abdomen). Personalized Shiatsu treatment according to your energetic profile, integrating techniques from the 3 schools.

steps.name: BUN SHIN (Listening & Advice)
steps.description: Post-session debrief and listening to your feelings. Personalized advice: self-massage, breathing exercises (Do-In), lifestyle according to your energetic assessment.

points.name: Recommended Traditional Attire
points.description: Loose and comfortable clothing made of natural fibers (cotton, linen). Avoid synthetics and prominent seams that disrupt energy circulation. No metal jewelry.

points.name: Dietary Protocol
points.description: Fast for at least 2 hours before the session. Avoid alcohol, coffee, and stimulants 4 hours before. Moderate hydration (empty bladder for abdominal diagnosis).

points.name: Post-Treatment and Reactions
points.description: Rest for at least 30 minutes post-session. Abundant hydration (1.5L within 24h). Possible reactions: fatigue, emotions, temporary worsening (a sign of energetic release).

points.name: Medications and Treatments
points.description: Inform me of all current treatments. NEVER interrupt a medical treatment. Shiatsu complements but does not replace conventional medicine.

aboutPage.title: Nathalie JEAN - 20 Years of Expertise in Shiatsu
aboutPage.subtitle: From my first certification on March 8, 2006, to today, a journey dedicated to the true art of traditional Japanese Shiatsu and the generous support of each person.

intro.heading: A moment that should be like an exchange with an old acquaintance without judgment or preconceptions.
intro.p1: After 20 years of practice, I have developed this ability to become a familiar and reassuring presence for my patients, free from any judgment. My approach is inspired by the masters: the scientific rigor of Namikoshi, the psychosomatic depth of Masunaga, and the energetic finesse of Kishi's Seiki.
intro.p2: Each session is a silent dialogue between my hands and your body, guided by more than two decades of experience and continuous learning. I do not heal; I accompany your own capacity for self-regulation towards balance.

timeline.heading: My Professional Journey - Over 20 Years of Experience

events.title: André Nahum School - Shiatsu according to Namikoshi
events.description: Training in the founding school of modern Shiatsu, based on Western anatomy and the pressure techniques developed by Tokujiro Namikoshi.

events.title: Start of Professional Practice
events.description: March 8, 2006 marks the beginning of my professional support. Since that date, I have been supporting my patients with the same investment and pleasure.

events.title: OHASHIATSU CERTIFICATE - Therapeutic Certification
events.description: Deepening with the Ohashiatsu approach, integrating a mind-body and energetic dimension for more complete support.

events.title: Wellness Massage Teacher - Spa 5 Mondes
events.description: Teaching experience at the Spa 5 Mondes, enriching my practice with experience in a luxury wellness center.

events.title: Certified Ohashiatsu Instructor
events.description: Obtaining the instructor certification, allowing me to transmit Ohashiatsu techniques and train other practitioners.

events.title: SEIKI SHIATSU Training with Tzvika Calisar
events.description: Beginning of advanced training in the art of Seiki Shiatsu, the most subtle approach to Shiatsu, based on the accompaniment of primary vital energy.

events.title: Sophrology Certification RNCP
events.description: Obtaining the Sophrologist RNCP certification n°1100, adding a dimension of relaxation and stress management to my practice.

events.title: Completion of Seiki Shiatsu Training
events.description: Completion of the 83-hour comprehensive training in Seiki Shiatsu, mastering this advanced energetic approach for even more subtle support.

cnil.description: You can also file a complaint with the CNIL if you believe your rights are not being respected.

cookieConsent.title: We use cookies 🍪
cookieConsent.description: We use cookies to improve your Browse experience, analyze site usage, and offer you personalized content. Your privacy is important to us.

essentialCookies.title: Essential cookies
essentialCookies.description: Necessary for the site to function (navigation, security, session)

analyticsCookies.title: Analytical cookies
analyticsCookies.description: Help us understand how you use our site (pages viewed, time spent)

performanceCookies.title: Performance cookies
performanceCookies.description: Optimize the site's performance and loading speed

preferencesCookies.title: Preferences cookies
preferencesCookies.description: Remember your personal choices (language, theme, display preferences)

healthcareDisclaimer.title: Important Therapeutic Notices
healthcareDisclaimer.subtitle: Mandatory regulatory and professional information

notMedicalAdvice.title: Not a medical substitute
notMedicalAdvice.description: Shiatsu is a wellness practice that does not replace a medical diagnosis or treatment. In case of a health problem, consult your doctor.

ffstCertification.title: Official FFST Certification
ffstCertification.description: Certified FFST practitioner (500h+ training) according to European standards. Active member of the French Federation of Traditional Shiatsu.

emergencyContact.title: Medical emergencies
emergencyContact.description: In case of a life-threatening emergency, immediately contact 15 (SAMU), 18 (Firefighters) or go to the hospital emergency services.

dataProtection.title: Health data protection
dataProtection.description: All your personal information and health data are strictly protected according to the GDPR and professional secrecy.

credentials.title: Verified Professional Qualifications
items: ✓ Certified FFST (French Federation of Traditional Shiatsu)
✓ 500+ hours of validated theoretical and practical training
✓ Continuing education in anatomy, physiology, and energetics
✓ FFST code of ethics respected and signed
✓ Member of the FFST professional register (verifiable)

healthcareDisclaimer.contact: ⚠️ Important: For any questions concerning your current medical treatments, consult your doctor or specialist.
